quizInfo.title: Unit 7 Regex Quiz
quizInfo.description: Quiz covering Regex topics in unit 7.

quizQuestions.question: Which regex pattern would match exactly and only the FIRST lowercase, 3-letter WORD it finds ANYWHERE in the document?
What does the ^ character achieve in regex?
options: It indicates the end of a string.

quizQuestions.question: Which would be the correct way to find 1 quantity of EITHER (any digit OR any UPPERCASE letter) which is then IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWED by a '.' period character?
In bootstrap, which class is used to wrap a group of form-controls?
What does the `+` plus sign character mean in regex patterns.
options: It looks for 1 or more of the preceding character.
It makes your regex pattern invalid in an html input.
It adds digits together in a phone number pattern.

quizQuestions.question:
Which flag would allow you to find any word string of '/^apple/g' at the start of separate lines. example:
apple
apple
What is NOT a valid way to escape a hyphen?
options: Put the hyphen in the middle of a set like /[a-z-0-9]/
Include the hyphen at the start of a set like /[-a-z]/
Put the hyphen at the end of a set like /[a-z-]/

question: Which of the following is NOT a valid email according to the regex pattern.
/^[a-zA-Z0-9._-]{1,16}@[a-zA-Z0-9-]+.[a-zA-Z]{2,4}$/

quizQuestions.question: Which input element is applied to inputs to control styling?
Which regex pattern would NOT correctly exclude vowels?
